title: Bodacious Broccoli Salad Recipe
description: This delicious broccoli salad is made with fresh broccoli, bacon, and red onion tossed in a creamy dressing for the perfect party salad everyone loves!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Vegetable Salad Recipes Broccoli Salad Recipes Bodacious Broccoli Salad 4.6 (1,765) 1,354 Reviews 119 Photos This broccoli salad is a delicious combination of fresh broccoli, crispy bacon, red onion, and cheese with a creamy dressing. It's requested at every family gathering. Be sure to have copies of the recipe on hand, as everyone will ask for it! Submitted by Allrecipes Member Updated on July 9, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 8 slices bacon 2 heads fresh broccoli, chopped 1 ½ cups sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded ½ large red onion, chopped ⅔ cup mayonnaise ¼ cup red wine vinegar ⅛ cup white sugar 2 teaspoons ground black pepper 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until crisp and evenly browned, 8-10 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and crumble when cool enough to handle. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine bacon, broccoli, cheese, and onion in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, sugar, pepper, salt, and lemon juice together in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour over salad and toss to combine. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note I think this salad tastes best if prepared at least two hours before serving. I Made It Print 2,385 home cooks made it!
